sentences.english: Not that I don't want to go; I just haven't got the time.
sentences.chinese: 何嘗不想把我知道的都告訴你，只是有口難言。

sentences.english: And as with monkeys, so with humans.
sentences.chinese: 獼猴如此，人類又何嘗不經受着同樣的問題。

sentences.english: Did I ask you for a son, my lord?' she said.
sentences.chinese: 婦人說，我何嘗向我主求過兒子呢？

sentences.english: Violence can be contagious, but so can peaceful dialogue.
sentences.chinese: 暴力固然會傳染，和平對話又何嘗不會。

sentences.english: Our hearts and spirits are as mysterious and unfathomable as the virgin forest.
sentences.chinese: 你我的心靈，又何嘗不似原始森林一般神祕莫測？

sentences.english: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
sentences.chinese: 他們何嘗像風前的碎秸，如暴風颳去的糠秕呢。

sentences.english: Located in the the Peach Garden, beauty beauty, why life is music.
sentences.chinese: 落戶於桃花源，美景美人，何嘗人生不樂。

sentences.english: I'd like to tell you what I know but my lips are sealed.
sentences.chinese: 我何嘗不想把我知道的都告訴你，只是我有口難言。

sentences.english: Any that you would not recommend?
Would we expect any less from Pantone?
sentences.chinese: 我們何嘗不希望色卡少一點？

definition: old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
in the end/after all is said and done
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
